body:
Perhaps consider changing how many items are fetched etc.
see: https://github.com/AlexEMG/DeepLabCut/blob/master/deeplabcut/pose_estimation_tensorflow/dataset/pose_dataset_tensorpack.py#L187

https://github.com/AlexEMG/DeepLabCut/blob/master/deeplabcut/pose_estimation_tensorflow/dataset/pose_dataset_tensorpack.py#L255

Hi AlexEMG! 
I tried playing with different combinations but I still get the same error...

I could just run the code on various machines (laptop, server etc.). Probably best to directly look for tensorpack issues?

@katierupp - have you seen this?

Setting `processratio` to a number > 1 does not make sense. There should be no benefit starting more processes than the number of CPU cores available. And each process will take memory, leading to OOM.
Setting `processratio` to 1 or 0.5 or smaller would be better. `num_prefetch` can also be smaller to reduce RAM usage.
@eleonoreduroyon: can you test a small processratio? We will update the default in 2.1.

Hi everyone!

Thank you for all your input!
I modified the processratio to 0.5 and then 0.1. I also dropped num_prefetch to 50 and then 10. Additionally, I modified 'fork' to 'forkserver/spawn'. Despite all that, the error hasn't left... I added below the screenshots of my error and the modifications I've made. Any other ideas?


![Screenshot from 2019-09-30 16-03-56](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32446840/65922950-f6b4f080-e39b-11e9-9184-38e7152637f2.png)
![Screenshot from 2019-09-30 16-03-35](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32446840/65922951-f6b4f080-e39b-11e9-8cda-2f0dbc3abc61.png)
![Screenshot from 2019-09-30 16-02-55](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32446840/65922952-f6b4f080-e39b-11e9-924d-0fba94b8740b.png)
![Screenshot from 2019-09-30 16-02-33](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32446840/65922953-f74d8700-e39b-11e9-84a7-f8b61f6cdd0d.png)

I think `cfg.get('processratio', .1)` does not change the `processratio` to .1, if `processratio` is already set in config. 

Please just set it with `cfg['processratio'] = 0.1`, and verify whether you successfully set it, by printing its value in `pose_dataset_tensorpack.py`.

Same goes with the other options.
This is indeed the case, if the config file already contains the variable (which is true, after you run training once) then its value will not be overwritten.

Hi, 
Yes, you're right. In fact none of my modifications are being taken into account because I can see at the beginning processratio is not modified and it is still trying to call 'fork'. The warning message for fork is not modified although I changed it in the file. I got an additional error without calling anything after I tried to train once. Tried to train again the warning message is gone but it is still set to 'fork'...
![Screenshot from 2019-09-30 17-00-59](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32446840/65925150-8068bc00-e3a4-11e9-8b54-a0beecb2464a.png)
![Screenshot from 2019-09-30 17-01-17](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32446840/65925155-8363ac80-e3a4-11e9-852b-17be20b311b8.png)
![Screenshot from 2019-09-30 17-01-31](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32446840/65925160-86f73380-e3a4-11e9-8ccf-59e4597e30b9.png)
![Screenshot from 2019-09-30 16-59-07](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32446840/65925170-8bbbe780-e3a4-11e9-9118-7b1986e7f558.png)
![Screenshot from 2019-09-30 17-02-22](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32446840/65925184-9a0a0380-e3a4-11e9-94d8-4010b217354b.png)
![Screenshot from 2019-09-30 17-02-46](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32446840/65925182-99716d00-e3a4-11e9-9ec8-a29d17475819.png)
![Screenshot from 2019-09-30 17-03-03](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32446840/65925181-99716d00-e3a4-11e9-9d07-7e1504d99669.png)



![Screenshot from 2019-09-30 17-03-17](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32446840/65925191-9c6c5d80-e3a4-11e9-8903-8a61b6a52d1e.png)
![Screenshot from 2019-09-30 17-04-09](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32446840/65925188-9c6c5d80-e3a4-11e9-8273-e47056f69385.png)
![Screenshot from 2019-09-30 17-03-40](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32446840/65925190-9c6c5d80-e3a4-11e9-86bf-5f091e8f8234.png)

Hey guys!
I tried to use the other types of data augmentation by setting dataset_type to deterministic. This works with the default processratio and num-prefetch...
![Screenshot from 2019-09-30 17-16-13](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32446840/65925514-1c46f780-e3a6-11e9-8a9d-32bd42a8eea4.png)

Firstly when training with setting dataset_type to deterministic, tensorpack and hence these variables will not be used... 

Secondly, for me on my desktop (and even laptop) the code runs & trains. Perhaps you do not have enough memory? Do you have an outdated computer? Are the frames very large?
@eleonoreduroyon as an aside, for resnet_101 you will want to set `intermediate_supervision=True` ; I think that's not super clear in the docs, so I'll update this.
